intro: Ctenodon histrix var. multijugus, commonly known as the multijugus ctenodon, is a rare and unique variant of the ctenodon genus. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring multiple jugate (paired) leaves along its stem. This plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical significance lies in its morphological variations, which make it a subject of interest in botanical research. Due to its rarity, it is often cultivated in specialized horticultural settings.
